ground_truth: Holding the knife at belly level, he twists the long wide blade until he's looking at his own reflection in the polished steel. Glancing up, he reaches forward and positions the knife at a downward sloping angle at the base of the door. Turning the knife in different directions, cans, bottles, and boxes of food are reflected in the blade. Graham withdraws the knife and puts it down on the floor beside him. Then, frustrating himself on his belly, he makes to look under the door again. Having second thoughts, he grabs the knife and kneels up, setting the knife back down on the worktop. He rises to his feet and, head bowed, strides determinedly out into the hallway. Stopping in his tracks, Graham turns and marches back in, seizing the knife. He lies on his stomach by the pantry door. A clawed hand shoots out from under the door. Startled, Graham bangs his head and drops the knife. Retrieving the knife, Graham slices off the creature's fingers. Startled, the flock of birds springs from the maize fields, scattering and flying away. Later, Graham returns to the farmhouse, locking the door behind him, hurriedly checks the handle, then walks off past the open living room door. He stops dead and stares, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill on the sofa wearing silver foil cone hats. Without flinching, Graham turns stiffly and goes to sit on the stairs. Merrill sits still with his hands on his knees. Graham links his hands together. Merrill turns to Morgan. Graham makes a pained frown. Putting one hand on the post at the bottom of the stairs, Graham pulls himself wearily up and plods into the living room, moving up to the sofa. Bo holds up one arm. Graham does the same. Morgan and Merrill raise their arms. Graham eyes them uncertainly. All three. Merrill and Bo lower their arms, Morgan settles himself back down on the sofa. Graham hesitates a moment then steps forward, and sits beside his son on the end of the couch. Morgan peers up at his father. Merrill stares blankly ahead. He sighs. Now, in broad daylight, Merrill leaves his converted barn holding a large white cotton sack. A cigarette in one hand, he jogs down the grey-painted wooden stairs on the side of the building then trudges across the lawn towards the farmhouse. As he takes a drag on the cigarette, his attention is drawn to the field of maize. Merrill throws the cigarette butt to the ground, then slows to a gradual stop. Dumping the cotton sack, he reaches down, picks up a stone, and launches it into the field of maize. He stands immobile, watching the crop with anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description:
Certainly! Here is the transformed text with exact synonyms used:

---

Holding the dagger at abdomen height, he rotates the lengthy broad blade until he's gazing at his own image in the buffed metal. Peering up, he extends forward and places the dagger at a descending sloping inclination at the bottom of the entrance. Rotating the dagger in various orientations, tins, flasks, and cartons of provisions are mirrored in the blade. Graham retracts the dagger and sets it down on the ground beside him. Then, frustrating himself on his abdomen, he makes to examine beneath the entrance again. Having second reflections, he seizes the dagger and kneels up, placing the dagger back down on the countertop. He ascends to his feet and, head inclined, strides resolutely out into the corridor. Halting in his path, Graham pivots and marches back in, grasping the dagger. He reclines on his abdomen by the pantry entrance. A taloned hand lunges out from beneath the entrance. Startled, Graham knocks his head and releases the dagger. Recovering the dagger, Graham shears off the creature's digits. Startled, the flock of fowl leaps from the corn fields, dispersing and flying away. Later, Graham returns to the farmhouse, securing the entrance behind him, hastily inspects the handle, then walks off past the open lounge entrance. He halts abruptly and gazes, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill on the settee wearing silver foil cone headgear. Without flinching, Graham turns rigidly and proceeds to sit on the stairs. Merrill remains still with his hands on his thighs. Graham links his hands together. Merrill turns to Morgan. Graham forms a pained scowl. Placing one hand on the pillar at the bottom of the stairs, Graham pulls himself wearily up and trudges into the lounge, moving up to the settee. Bo lifts up one limb. Graham does the same. Morgan and Merrill raise their limbs. Graham observes them uncertainly. All three. Merrill and Bo lower their limbs, Morgan settles himself back down on the settee. Graham pauses a moment then steps ahead, and sits beside his offspring on the end of the couch. Morgan gazes up at his progenitor. Merrill stares blankly ahead. He exhales. Now, in broad daylight, Merrill departs his modified barn holding a sizable white cotton sack. A cigarette in one hand, he jogs down the grey-painted timber stairs on the flank of the structure then plods across the grass towards the farmhouse. As he takes a puff on the cigarette, his focus is drawn to the field of corn. Merrill tosses the cigarette butt to the ground, then slows to a gradual stop. Discarding the cotton sack, he reaches down, picks up a pebble, and hurls it into the field of corn. He stands motionless, observing the crop with anxious expectation.

As he glances up, the knife is reached for and positioned at a downward sloping angle by him at the base of the door. As he turns the knife in different directions, the blade reflects cans, bottles, and boxes of food. The knife is withdrawn by Graham and put down on the floor beside him. By the pantry door, he lies on his stomach. A clawed hand is shot out from under the door. Startled, his head is banged by Graham, and the knife is dropped. Graham retrieves the knife and slices off the creature's fingers. Startled, the maize fields are sprung from by the flock of birds, scattering and flying away. Later, the farmhouse is returned to by Graham, and the door is locked behind him, hurriedly checking the handle, then walking off past the open living room door. He stops dead and stares, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill on the sofa as silver foil cone hats are worn by them. Without flinching, he turns stiffly and goes to sit on the stairs. Still with his hands on his knees, Merrill sits. Graham links his hands together. Morgan is turned to by Merrill. A pained frown is made by Graham. One hand is put on the post at the bottom of the stairs, and Graham pulls himself wearily up and plods into the living room, moving up to the sofa. One arm is held up by Bo. The same is done by Graham. Their arms are raised by Morgan and Merrill. They are eyed uncertainly by Graham. All three. The arms of Merrill and Bo are lowered, and Morgan settles himself back down on the sofa. A moment's hesitation is shown by Graham, then the step forward is taken, and he sits beside his son on the end of the couch. Morgan peers up at his father. Ahead is stared at blankly by Merrill. A sigh is released by him. Now, in broad daylight, a large white cotton sack is held by Merrill as he leaves his converted barn. In one hand, a cigarette is held by him, and he jogs down the grey-painted wooden stairs on the side of the building, then trudges across the lawn towards the farmhouse. As a drag is taken on the cigarette, his attention is directed towards the field of maize. The cigarette butt is thrown to the ground by Merrill, then a gradual stop is made. The cotton sack is dumped, and he reaches down, picks up a stone, and launches it into the field of maize. Immobile, he stands, the crop being watched with anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Holding the knife at belly level, he twists the long blade to see his reflection in the polished steel. He positions the knife at a downward angle by the door's base. Turning it, cans, bottles, and food boxes reflect in the blade. Graham puts the knife down, lies on his stomach to look under the door, then reconsiders. Grabbing the knife, he kneels, sets it on the worktop, rises, and walks into the hallway. Stopping, Graham returns, seizes the knife, and lies by the pantry door. A clawed hand emerges; startled, Graham drops the knife. Retrieving it, he slices off the creature's fingers. Startled birds scatter from the maize fields. Graham later returns, locks the farmhouse, checks the handle, and passes the open living room. He freezes, seeing Bo, Morgan, and Merrill on the sofa wearing silver foil cone hats. Graham turns and sits on the stairs. Merrill sits with hands on his knees. Graham links his hands, frowns, and pulls himself up to the sofa. Bo raises one arm, Graham mimics, followed by Morgan and Merrill. Graham hesitates, then sits beside Morgan. Merrill stares ahead. He sighs. In daylight, Merrill leaves his barn with a cotton sack. Cigarette in hand, he jogs down stairs, crosses the lawn toward the farmhouse, and notices the maize field. He discards the cigarette, stops, dumps the sack, picks up a stone, and throws it into the field, watching anxiously.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Holding the knife at belly level, he twists it to see his reflection in the polished steel. He positions the knife downward at the door's base, reflecting cans, bottles, and boxes in the blade. Graham sets the knife down, looks under the door, then kneels to replace the knife on the worktop. Rising, he strides into the hallway but returns to grab the knife. Lying by the pantry door, a clawed hand appears, startling him. He drops the knife, slices off the creature's fingers, and birds scatter from the maize fields. Later, Graham locks the farmhouse door, checks the handle, and walks past the living room. He sees Bo, Morgan, and Merrill on the sofa with silver foil hats. Graham sits on the stairs, Merrill turns to Morgan, and Graham frowns. Graham joins them, sitting beside his son. Morgan looks at his father while Merrill stares blankly. In daylight, Merrill leaves his barn with a white cotton sack, cigarette in hand, and jogs to the farmhouse. Noticing the maize field, he discards the cigarette, throws a stone into the field, and watches anxiously.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Holding the gleaming knife at the level of his belly, he skillfully twists the long, wide blade in his hand until he catches sight of his own reflection mirrored back at him in the polished steel surface. Glancing upward for a moment, he extends his arm forward, carefully positioning the knife at an angle that slopes downward, placing it at the base of the door. As he rotates the knife in various directions, the shiny blade catches the light, reflecting images of cans, bottles, and boxes of food stored nearby. Graham eventually retracts the knife and gently places it down on the floor beside him. Then, frustratingly lowering himself onto his stomach, he prepares to peer under the door once again. However, having a moment of hesitation, he reaches for the knife once more and rises to his knees, setting the knife back down securely on the worktop. Standing up, he bows his head and strides purposefully out into the hallway. Abruptly stopping in his tracks, Graham pivots and marches back in, snatching the knife from its place. He proceeds to lie on his stomach beside the pantry door. Suddenly, a clawed hand shoots out from beneath the door, causing Graham to jolt in surprise, banging his head and dropping the knife. Without delay, he retrieves the knife and swiftly slices off the creature's fingers. Startled by the commotion, a flock of birds takes to the sky, springing from the maize fields, scattering and flying away in all directions. Later on, Graham returns to the farmhouse, locking the door securely behind him, and hurriedly checks the handle to ensure it's fastened tight, then he walks past the open living room door. He comes to an abrupt halt and stares, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill seated on the sofa, each wearing whimsical silver foil cone hats. Without hesitating, Graham turns stiffly and goes to take a seat on the stairs. Merrill remains seated, his hands resting on his knees. Graham links his hands together in contemplation. Merrill turns his gaze to Morgan. Graham makes a pained expression, frowning slightly. Placing one hand on the post at the bottom of the stairs, Graham uses it to pull himself up wearily, then trudges into the living room, moving closer to the sofa. Bo raises one arm, a gesture mirrored by Graham. Both Morgan and Merrill lift their arms in unison. Graham watches them, his expression uncertain. All three of them share in the moment. Merrill and Bo lower their arms, while Morgan settles himself back down comfortably on the sofa. Graham hesitates for a moment, then takes a step forward and sits beside his son at the end of the couch. Morgan looks up at his father inquisitively. Merrill stares blankly into the distance. He lets out a sigh of resignation. Now, in the bright light of day, Merrill departs from his converted barn, a large white cotton sack in hand. With a cigarette held in one hand, he jogs down the grey-painted wooden stairs on the side of the building and then trudges across the lawn, headed towards the farmhouse. As he takes a long drag on the cigarette, his attention is drawn to the expansive field of maize. Merrill discards the cigarette butt to the ground with little regard, then slows to a gradual stop. Dumping the cotton sack, he bends down, picks up a stone, and with precise aim, launches it into the field of maize. He stands there motionless, his gaze fixed on the crop, filled with anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With the gleaming knife held steadily at the level of his belly, he skillfully and adeptly twists the long and wide blade within his hand, carefully maneuvering it until he catches sight of his own reflection, mirrored back at him, in the meticulously polished steel surface. After briefly glancing upward for just a moment, he extends his arm forward with precision, carefully positioning the knife at an angle that slopes downward, placing it right at the base of the door. As he continues to rotate the knife in various directions, the shiny blade persistently catches the light, reflecting distinct images of cans, bottles, and boxes of food that are stored nearby. After a moment, Graham eventually retracts the knife and gently places it down on the floor right beside him. Then, frustratingly, he lowers himself onto his stomach, mentally preparing to peer under the door once more. However, he suddenly has a moment of hesitation, during which he reaches for the knife one more time and rises to his knees, setting the knife back down with care on the sturdy worktop. Standing up straight, he bows his head in thought and strides purposefully out into the hallway. Abruptly, he stops in his tracks, pivots in place, and decisively marches back in, promptly snatching the knife from its resting place. He then proceeds to lie on his stomach beside the pantry door. Suddenly, without warning, a clawed hand shoots out from beneath the door, causing Graham to jolt in surprise, banging his head and dropping the knife in the process. Without delay, he retrieves the knife quickly and skillfully slices off the creature's fingers. Startled by the unexpected commotion, a flock of birds takes to the sky, springing from the vast maize fields, scattering and flying away furiously in all directions. Later on, Graham returns to the farmhouse, locking the door securely behind him, and hurriedly checks the handle to ensure that it is fastened tight; he then walks past the open living room door. He comes to an abrupt halt and stares in surprise, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill seated comfortably on the sofa, each wearing whimsical silver foil cone hats. Without a moment's hesitation, Graham turns stiffly and proceeds to take a seat on the stairs. Merrill remains seated, his hands resting calmly on his knees. Graham links his hands together in a gesture of contemplation. Merrill turns his gaze thoughtfully to Morgan. Graham makes a pained expression, frowning slightly in discomfort. Placing one hand firmly on the post at the bottom of the stairs, Graham uses it to pull himself up wearily, then he trudges into the living room, moving slowly closer to the sofa. Bo raises one arm, a gesture mirrored in synchrony by Graham. Both Morgan and Merrill lift their arms simultaneously in unison. Graham watches them carefully, his expression uncertain. All three of them share in the collective moment. Merrill and Bo lower their arms slowly, while Morgan settles himself back down comfortably on the inviting sofa. Graham hesitates for a brief moment, then takes a step forward and sits beside his son at the far end of the couch. Morgan looks up at his father inquisitively and with curiosity. Merrill stares blankly ahead into the distance. He lets out a deep sigh of resignation. Now, in the bright and clear light of day, Merrill departs from his converted barn, carrying a large white cotton sack in hand. With a cigarette held casually in one hand, he jogs down the grey-painted wooden stairs situated on the side of the building and then trudges across the lawn, making his way towards the farmhouse. As he takes a long drag on the cigarette, his attention is drawn to the expansive field of maize. With little regard, Merrill discards the cigarette butt to the ground, then slows to a gradual stop. Dumping the cotton sack, he bends down, picks up a stone, and with precise aim, launches it into the expansive field of maize. He stands there motionless, his gaze fixed intently on the crop, filled with anxious and palpable expectation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Holding the knife securely at belly level, he begins by twisting the long, wide blade with deliberate care, adjusting it until the polished steel reveals his own reflection staring back at him. With a quick glance upward, he extends his arm forward, ensuring a firm grip, and positions the knife so that it slopes downward, resting at the base of the door. As he turns the knife in varied directions, the blade captures the reflections of scattered cans, bottles, and boxes of food. Deciding momentarily to withdraw, he carefully places the knife down on the floor beside him. Frustrated, he lowers himself to his belly, intending to peer under the door once more. A change of heart prompts him to grasp the knife again, and he kneels up cautiously, setting the blade back onto the worktop before standing. Head bowed, he strides out into the hallway with determined steps. Abruptly stopping in his tracks, he turns sharply and retraces his steps back into the room, swiftly seizing the knife with renewed resolve. He then lies prone by the pantry door, poised to act. Suddenly, from beneath the door, a clawed hand darts out, startling him so much that he inadvertently bangs his head and drops the knife. Recovering quickly, he retrieves the knife and, with a swift movement, slices off the creature's fingers. The suddenness of his action startles a flock of birds, causing them to spring up from the maize fields, scattering and taking to the sky. Later, Graham returns to the farmhouse, ensuring his security by locking the door firmly behind him and hurriedly checking the handle to confirm it's secure, before walking past the open living room door. He halts abruptly, staring in disbelief at Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill seated on the sofa, all donning silver foil cone hats. Without betraying his astonishment, Graham turns with a stiff motion and moves to sit on the stairs. Merrill remains motionless, hands resting on his knees. Graham interlocks his fingers thoughtfully. Merrill then turns to Morgan, prompting Graham to make a pained frown of contemplation. With a weary gesture, he places one hand on the post at the bottom of the stairs, using it to pull himself upright, before plodding into the living room and advancing toward the sofa. Bo raises one arm, an action Graham mirrors tentatively. Morgan and Merrill follow suit, lifting their arms. Graham observes them with uncertainty, noting that all three have now joined in. Merrill and Bo lower their arms, while Morgan settles back into the sofa comfortably. Graham hesitates, contemplating his next move, then decisively steps forward and positions himself beside his son on the end of the couch. Morgan looks up at his father with curiosity, as Merrill stares blankly ahead and sighs, seemingly lost in thought. The scene shifts to broad daylight, where Merrill exits his converted barn, carrying a large white cotton sack. With a cigarette held in one hand, he descends the grey-painted wooden stairs that flank the building, jogging down with ease before trudging across the lawn toward the farmhouse. As he takes a drag from the cigarette, his gaze is drawn intently to the field of maize, piquing his curiosity. With a purposeful gesture, he throws the cigarette butt to the ground, coming to a gradual halt. He then dumps the cotton sack unceremoniously, bends down to grab a stone, and hurls it into the field of maize with forceful intent, before standing still, watching the crop with an air of anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Holding the knife at belly level, he examines his reflection in the polished steel, then positions the blade at a downward angle at the base of the door. As the blade reflects various food items, Graham places the knife on the floor, considers looking under the door, but then reconsiders and rises to his feet, leaving the room with determined strides. Pausing, he returns, retrieves the knife, and lies on his stomach by the pantry door. A clawed hand suddenly appears from under the door, startling Graham, who drops the knife. He quickly recovers and slices off the creature's fingers, prompting a flock of birds to scatter from the maize fields. Later, Graham locks the farmhouse door behind him, checks the handle, and stops at the living room entrance, where he sees Bo, Morgan, and Merrill wearing silver foil hats. He turns and sits on the stairs, linking his hands together, then weary, joins them on the sofa after a moment of hesitation. Bo and the others raise their arms in unison with Graham, then lower them. Graham sits beside his son, Morgan, who looks up at him, while Merrill stares blankly ahead. Graham sighs, then shifts to the next scene: in daylight, Merrill exits the barn with a large sack, smoking a cigarette. He jogs down the stairs, crosses the lawn, and is drawn to the maize field. He discards the cigarette, picks up a stone, and throws it into the field, watching anxiously.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Holding the knife, a tool crafted from high-carbon stainless steel, at belly level, he twists the long wide blade until he's looking at his own reflection in the polished steel, reminiscent of how ancient warriors might have examined their weapons. Glancing up, he reaches forward and positions the knife at a downward sloping angle at the base of the door, an old oak door that creaked with age. Turning the knife in different directions, cans, bottles, and boxes of food are reflected, items likely stocked for emergencies, in the blade. Graham, a former military man who has faced tense situations before, withdraws the knife and puts it down on the floor beside him. Then, frustrating himself by lying flat on his belly, he makes to look under the door of the pantry, a narrow room used to store surplus supplies. Having second thoughts, he grabs the knife and kneels up, setting the knife back down on the worktop made of worn pine. He rises to his feet and, head bowed as if deep in thought, strides determinedly out into the hallway lined with family photos. Stopping in his tracks, Graham turns, driven by a sense of duty, and marches back in, seizing the knife once more. He lies on his stomach by the pantry door. A clawed hand, resembling that of a creature from folklore, shoots out from under the door. Startled, Graham bangs his head against the rustic wooden floor and drops the knife. Retrieving the knife, Graham slices off the creature's fingers, an action he had never anticipated doing. Startled, the flock of birds, perhaps crows or starlings, springs from the maize fields, scattering and flying away in a chaotic flurry. Later, Graham, feeling a mix of relief and dread, returns to the farmhouse, a structure built in the late 19th century, locking the door behind him and hurriedly checks the handle, a habit born of heightened caution, then walks off past the open living room door. He stops dead and stares, seeing Bo, Morgan, and now Merrill on the sofa wearing silver foil cone hats, a makeshift attempt to block signals based on urban legends about alien invasions. Without flinching, Graham turns stiffly and goes to sit on the stairs, an old wooden flight that creaks with each step. Merrill sits still with his hands on his knees, a posture conveying both tension and determination. Graham links his hands together in silent contemplation. Merrill turns to Morgan, the younger sibling, seeking reassurance. Graham makes a pained frown, the weight of responsibility heavy on his mind. Putting one hand on the post at the bottom of the stairs, Graham pulls himself wearily up and plods into the living room, moving up to the sofa where the family often gathered. Bo holds up one arm, mimicking a gesture they had seen together on TV. Graham does the same, a silent show of unity. Morgan and Merrill, siblings with a close bond, raise their arms. Graham eyes them uncertainly, unsure of what comfort to offer. All three, a small but steadfast family, share a moment of unity. Merrill and Bo lower their arms, and Morgan settles himself back down on the sofa, a vintage piece inherited from their grandparents. Graham hesitates a moment then steps forward, and sits beside his son on the end of the couch. Morgan peers up at his father with a look of trust. Merrill stares blankly ahead, lost in his own thoughts. He sighs, a release of pent-up tension. Now, in broad daylight, Merrill leaves his converted barn, a building adapted for modern use, holding a large white cotton sack filled with supplies. A cigarette in one hand, he jogs down the grey-painted wooden stairs on the side of the building, then trudges across the lawn towards the farmhouse. As he takes a drag on the cigarette, a habit picked up during long hours of farm work, his attention is drawn to the field of maize, known for its dense growth. Merrill throws the cigarette butt to the ground, then slows to a gradual stop. Dumping the cotton sack, he reaches down, picks up a stone, a smooth rock from the nearby creek, and launches it into the field of maize. He stands immobile, watching the crop with anxious expectation, aware of the strange occurrences that have disturbed their peace.

He rises to his feet and head bowed strides determinedly out into the hallway. Stopping in his tracks Graham turns and marches back in seizing the knife. He lies on his stomach by the pantry door. A clawed hand shoots out from under the door. Startled. Graham bangs his head and drops the knife. Retrieving the knife Graham slices off the creature's fingers. Startled. the flock of birds springs from the maize fields scattering and flying away. Later Graham returns to the farmhouse locking the door behind him hurriedly checks the handle then walks off past the open living room door. He stops dead and stares seeing Bo. Morgan and now Merrill on the sofa wearing silver foil cone hats. Without flinching. Graham turns stiffly and goes to sit on the stairs. Merrill sits still with his hands on his knees. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Graham links his hands together. Merrill turns to Morgan. Graham makes a pained frown. Putting one hand on the post at the bottom of the stairs. Graham pulls himself wearily up and plods into the living room. moving up to the sofa. Bo holds up one arm. Graham does the same. Morgan and Merrill raise their arms. Graham eyes them uncertainly. All three Merrill and Bo lower their arms. Morgan settles himself back down on the sofa. Graham hesitates a moment then steps forward and sits beside his son on the end of the couch. Morgan peers up at his father. Merrill stares blankly ahead. He sighs. Now in broad daylight Merrill leaves his converted barn holding a large white cotton sack. A cigarette in one hand. he jogs down the greypainted wooden stairs on the side of the building then trudges across the lawn towards the farmhouse. As he takes a drag on the cigarette his attention is drawn to the field of maize. Merrill throws the cigarette butt to the ground then slows to a gradual stop. Dumping the cotton sack he reaches down picks up a stone and launches it into the field of maize. He stands immobile watching the crop with anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Holding the knife at belly level he twists the long wide blade until he is looking at his own reflection in the polished steel. Glancing up he reaches forward and positions the knife at a downward sloping angle at the base of the door. Turning the knife in different directions. cans bottles and boxes of food are reflected in the blade. Graham withdraws the knife and puts it down on the floor beside him. Then frustrating himself on his belly he makes to look under the door again. Having second thoughts he grabs the knife and kneels up setting the knife back down on the worktop. He rises to his feet and head bowed strides determinedly out into the hallway. Stopping in his tracks Graham turns and marches back in seizing the knife. He lies on his stomach by the pantry door. A clawed hand shoots out from under the door. Morgan settles himself back down on the sofa. Graham hesitates a moment then steps forward and sits beside his son on the end of the couch. Dumping the cotton sack he reaches down picks up a stone and launches it into the field of maize. He stands immobile watching the crop with anxious expectation.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Clutching the spoon at eye level, the cat spins the narrow tall stick until it's inspecting its own silhouette in the shiny glass. Peering sideways, the cat stretches backward and aligns the spoon at an upward arching angle at the edge of the window. Twirling the spoon in varied orientations, hats, scarves, and shoes are mirrored in the glass. Rufus retracts the spoon and places it down on the chair beside it. Then, amusing itself on its back, it begins to peek over the window again. Rethinking, it snatches the spoon and stands down, situating the spoon back down on the countertop. It reclines in its chair and, eyes closed, tiptoes lazily out into the kitchen. Freezing in his stretch, Rufus spins and dances back in, grabbing the spoon. It reclines on its back by the cupboard window. A feathered wing flutters out from over the window. Alarmed, Rufus taps its ear and flings the spoon. Reclaiming the spoon, Rufus nibbles off the plant's petals. Alarmed, the swarm of bees leaps from the flower pots, buzzing and zooming away. Eventually, Rufus moseys to the garden shed, swinging the window behind it, slowly lifts the latch, then skips off past the closed dining room window. It freezes solid and gawks, spotting Alice, Max, and soon Oliver on the carpet sporting golden velvet round shoes. Not blinking, Rufus glances gracefully and goes to perch on the stools. Oliver sits quiet with its paws on its chin. Rufus ties its paws together. Oliver glances at Max. Rufus forms a puzzled smile. Placing one paw on the rail at the top of the stairs, Rufus pulls itself briskly down and prances into the dining room, settling down to the carpet. Alice raises one foot. Rufus does the same. Max and Oliver kick their feet. Rufus watches them cautiously. All four. Oliver and Alice drop their feet, Max leans himself back up on the carpet. Rufus pauses a second then glides backward, and perches next to its daughter on the middle of the rug. Max peers down at its sibling. Oliver glares blankly away. It gasps. Now, in dim moonlight, Oliver departs its painted cabin clutching a tiny black leather pouch. A cookie in one paw, it strolls up the red-tiled metal ladder on the top of the tower then springs across the balcony towards the shed. As it eats a piece of the cookie, its gaze is diverted to the cluster of flowers. Oliver tosses the cookie crumb to the air, then dances to a gradual leap. Heaving the leather pouch, it reaches up, snatches a note, and darts it into the cluster of flowers. It stands animated, observing the blooms with curious excitement.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Graham examines his reflection in a knife blade, contemplating his next move. He positions the knife under a door but reconsiders, eventually seizing it again. Startled by a clawed hand that emerges, he drops the knife but quickly recovers, slicing off the creature's fingers. A flock of birds takes flight in response. Graham locks himself in the farmhouse with family members Bo, Morgan, and Merrill, who are wearing foil hats. He joins them on the sofa amid a tense atmosphere. Merrill later exits the barn, cigarette in hand, and is distracted by the maize field. After discarding his cigarette, he nervously throws a stone into the field, waiting for a response.
